intro: Mecodium reinwardtii, commonly known as the African snowball, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its dense clusters of white, fluffy flowers that resemble small snowballs. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Mecodium reinwardtii thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or rocky habitats.
